metadata.title: CVE-2020-35635 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A code execution vulnerability exists in the Nef polygon-parsingfunctionality of CGAL libcgal CGAL-5.1.1 in Nef_S2/SNC_io_parser.hSNC_io_parser::read_sface() store_sm_boundary_item() Sloop_of OOB read. Aspecially crafted malformed file can lead to an out-of-bounds read and typeconfusion, which could lead to code execution. An attacker can providemalicious input to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgal-demo - 5.2-3
libcgal-ipelets - 5.2-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cgal package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2-3').
